name: Developer Workday
description: A task management application inspired by Akiflow - an event-driven task management system with JavaFX UI, MapDB persistence, global shortcuts, and system tray integration

tasks.title: Project Architecture Setup
tasks.description: Set up the base project architecture following MVC pattern with clear separation of concerns: UI Controllers, Facades, Services, Mappers, and Repositories
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Project Architecture Setup
  Scenario: Project has proper package structure
    Given a Maven project with JavaFX dependencies
    When the project is initialized
    Then it should have packages for 'ui.controllers', 'facade', 'service', 'mapper', 'repository', 'model', 'event', 'config', and 'utils'
    And each layer should only communicate with its adjacent layers
    And dependency injection should be configured properly

tasks.title: MapDB Integration and Configuration
tasks.description: Integrate MapDB library for file-based persistence. Configure database connection, file location, and serialization settings
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: MapDB Integration
  Scenario: MapDB database is initialized on application start
    Given the application is starting
    When the database configuration is loaded
    Then a MapDB file-backed database should be created in the user's application data directory
    And the database should support transactions
    And the database should be closed gracefully on application shutdown

  Scenario: Database file persistence
    Given tasks have been saved to the database
    When the application is restarted
    Then all previously saved tasks should be loaded from the database file

tasks.title: Task Entity Model
tasks.description: Create the Task entity model with all necessary fields: id, title, description, dueDate, dueTime, priority, status, categoryId, createdAt, updatedAt, completedAt, recurrence, reminder settings, and tags
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Task Entity Model
  Scenario: Task entity has all required fields
    Given a Task entity class
    Then it should have fields for 'id' (UUID), 'title' (String), 'description' (String)
    And it should have 'dueDate' (LocalDate), 'dueTime' (LocalTime), 'scheduledDate' (LocalDate)
    And it should have 'priority' (enum: LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH, URGENT)
    And it should have 'status' (enum: TODO, IN_PROGRESS, COMPLETED, CANCELLED)
    And it should have 'categoryId' (UUID), 'tags' (List<String>)
    And it should have 'createdAt', 'updatedAt', 'completedAt' (LocalDateTime)
    And it should have 'recurrence' (RecurrenceRule), 'reminderMinutesBefore' (Integer)
    And it should have 'estimatedDuration' (Duration), 'actualDuration' (Duration)
    And it should implement Serializable for MapDB storage

tasks.title: Category Entity Model
tasks.description: Create the Category entity model with fields for organizing tasks into groups with customizable colors and icons
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Category Entity Model
  Scenario: Category entity has all required fields
    Given a Category entity class
    Then it should have fields for 'id' (UUID), 'name' (String), 'description' (String)
    And it should have 'color' (String - hex code), 'icon' (String - icon identifier)
    And it should have 'parentCategoryId' (UUID) for nested categories
    And it should have 'sortOrder' (Integer), 'isDefault' (Boolean)
    And it should have 'createdAt', 'updatedAt' (LocalDateTime)
    And it should implement Serializable for MapDB storage

tasks.title: Event Base Classes and Event setup
tasks.description: Create the event-driven architecture foundation with base event classes and an event setup for keeping track of user events and resolve the state changes due to them, that keeps track of the timing of eventsas well
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Event Base Classes
  Scenario: Base event class is created
    Given an abstract Event class
    Then it should have fields for 'eventId' (UUID), 'timestamp' (LocalDateTime), 'eventType' (String)
    And it should have methods for getting event details

  Scenario: Event dispatcher is implemented
    Given an EventDispatcher class
    When an event is published
    Then all registered listeners for that event type should be notified
    And listeners should be able to subscribe and unsubscribe from events

  Scenario: Event logging is functional
    Given an event is published
    When the event occurs
    Then the event details should be logged to a persistent store for audit purposes

tasks.title: Task-Related Events
tasks.description: Create event classes for all task-related user actions: TaskCreatedEvent, TaskUpdatedEvent, TaskDeletedEvent, TaskCompletedEvent, TaskScheduledEvent, TaskPriorityChangedEvent, TaskMovedToCategoryEvent
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Task Events
  Scenario: TaskCreatedEvent is published when a task is created
    Given a user creates a new task
    When the task is saved successfully
    Then a TaskCreatedEvent should be published
    And the event should contain the complete task data

  Scenario: TaskCompletedEvent is published when a task is marked complete
    Given a user marks a task as complete
    When the task status is updated
    Then a TaskCompletedEvent should be published
    And the event should contain the task id and completion timestamp

  Scenario: TaskUpdatedEvent contains before and after states
    Given a user edits a task
    When the task is updated
    Then a TaskUpdatedEvent should be published
    And the event should contain both old and new task states

tasks.title: Category-Related Events
tasks.description: Create event classes for category actions: CategoryCreatedEvent, CategoryUpdatedEvent, CategoryDeletedEvent, CategoryReorderedEvent
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Category Events
  Scenario: CategoryCreatedEvent is published when a category is created
    Given a user creates a new category
    When the category is saved successfully
    Then a CategoryCreatedEvent should be published
    And the event should contain the complete category data

  Scenario: CategoryDeletedEvent handles task reassignment
    Given a category with tasks is deleted
    When the CategoryDeletedEvent is published
    Then it should contain information about affected tasks
    And listeners should handle task reassignment to default category

tasks.title: Task Repository with MapDB
tasks.description: Implement TaskRepository class that handles all database operations for tasks using MapDB, hiding the implementation details from the service layer
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Task Repository
  Scenario: Save a new task
    Given a Task entity
    When the repository save method is called
    Then the task should be persisted in MapDB
    And the task should be retrievable by its ID

  Scenario: Find tasks by category
    Given multiple tasks in different categories
    When findByCategoryId is called with a specific category ID
    Then only tasks belonging to that category should be returned

  Scenario: Find tasks by date range
    Given tasks with various due dates
    When findByDueDateBetween is called with a date range
    Then only tasks within that date range should be returned

  Scenario: Find overdue tasks
    Given tasks with past due dates that are not completed
    When findOverdueTasks is called
    Then all uncompleted tasks with past due dates should be returned

tasks.title: Category Repository with MapDB
tasks.description: Implement CategoryRepository class that handles all database operations for categories using MapDB
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Category Repository
  Scenario: Save a new category
    Given a Category entity
    When the repository save method is called
    Then the category should be persisted in MapDB
    And the category should be retrievable by its ID

  Scenario: Find all categories ordered by sort order
    Given multiple categories with different sort orders
    When findAllOrdered is called
    Then categories should be returned in ascending sort order

  Scenario: Find child categories
    Given categories with parent-child relationships
    When findByParentId is called
    Then only direct child categories should be returned

tasks.title: Event Store Repository
tasks.description: Implement EventStoreRepository to persist all application events for audit trail and potential event replay functionality
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Event Store Repository
  Scenario: Persist application events
    Given any application event
    When the event is published
    Then it should be saved to the event store with timestamp
    And it should be retrievable for audit purposes

  Scenario: Query events by type and date range
    Given stored events of various types
    When querying by event type and date range
    Then matching events should be returned in chronological order

tasks.title: MapStruct Task Mapper
tasks.description: Create MapStruct mapper interfaces for converting between Task entities, DTOs, and view models
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Task Mapper
  Scenario: Map Task entity to TaskDTO
    Given a Task entity with all fields populated
    When the mapper toDTO method is called
    Then a TaskDTO should be returned with all fields correctly mapped

  Scenario: Map TaskDTO to Task entity
    Given a TaskDTO from the UI layer
    When the mapper toEntity method is called
    Then a Task entity should be created with all fields correctly mapped

  Scenario: Map Task to TaskListItemViewModel
    Given a Task entity
    When mapping to TaskListItemViewModel
    Then only display-relevant fields should be included
    And formatted date and time strings should be generated

tasks.title: MapStruct Category Mapper
tasks.description: Create MapStruct mapper interfaces for converting between Category entities, DTOs, and view models
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Category Mapper
  Scenario: Map Category entity to CategoryDTO
    Given a Category entity with all fields populated
    When the mapper toDTO method is called
    Then a CategoryDTO should be returned with all fields correctly mapped

  Scenario: Map CategoryDTO to Category entity
    Given a CategoryDTO from the UI layer
    When the mapper toEntity method is called
    Then a Category entity should be created with all fields correctly mapped

tasks.title: Task Service Implementation
tasks.description: Implement TaskService class with business logic for task operations: create, update, delete, complete, schedule, and search tasks
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Task Service
  Scenario: Create a new task
    Given valid task creation data
    When createTask is called
    Then the task should be saved via repository
    And a TaskCreatedEvent should be published
    And the created task should be returned

  Scenario: Complete a task
    Given an existing incomplete task
    When completeTask is called
    Then the task status should be set to COMPLETED
    And completedAt should be set to current timestamp
    And a TaskCompletedEvent should be published

  Scenario: Handle recurring task completion
    Given a recurring task
    When the task is completed
    Then a new task instance should be created for the next occurrence
    And the original task should be marked complete

tasks.title: Category Service Implementation
tasks.description: Implement CategoryService class with business logic for category operations: create, update, delete, reorder, and manage category hierarchy
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Category Service
  Scenario: Create a new category
    Given valid category creation data
    When createCategory is called
    Then the category should be saved via repository
    And a CategoryCreatedEvent should be published

  Scenario: Delete a category with tasks
    Given a category containing tasks
    When deleteCategory is called
    Then the user should be prompted for task handling (move to default or delete)
    And tasks should be handled according to user choice
    And the category should be deleted
    And a CategoryDeletedEvent should be published

tasks.title: Reminder Service Implementation
tasks.description: Implement ReminderService to schedule and trigger task reminders based on configured reminder times
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Reminder Service
  Scenario: Schedule a reminder for a task
    Given a task with a due date and reminder minutes before set
    When the task is created or updated
    Then a reminder should be scheduled for the specified time before due

  Scenario: Trigger reminder notification
    Given a scheduled reminder
    When the reminder time is reached
    Then a system notification should be displayed
    And a ReminderTriggeredEvent should be published

  Scenario: Cancel reminder when task is completed
    Given a task with a scheduled reminder
    When the task is completed before the reminder time
    Then the scheduled reminder should be cancelled

tasks.title: Task Facade Implementation
tasks.description: Implement TaskFacade as the main entry point for UI controllers to interact with task-related functionality, coordinating between multiple services
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Task Facade
  Scenario: Get tasks for today view
    Given tasks scheduled for today and overdue tasks
    When getTasksForToday is called
    Then overdue tasks should be returned first
    And tasks scheduled for today should follow
    And tasks should be sorted by time and priority

  Scenario: Quick add task
    Given a quick add task string like 'Buy groceries tomorrow at 5pm #personal'
    When quickAddTask is called
    Then the string should be parsed for task details
    And a task should be created with extracted title, date, time, and tags

  Scenario: Get task statistics
    Given a date range
    When getTaskStatistics is called
    Then statistics should include total tasks, completed, overdue, and completion rate

tasks.title: Category Facade Implementation
tasks.description: Implement CategoryFacade as the main entry point for UI controllers to interact with category-related functionality
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Category Facade
  Scenario: Get category tree
    Given categories with parent-child relationships
    When getCategoryTree is called
    Then a hierarchical tree structure of categories should be returned

  Scenario: Get category with task count
    Given categories with associated tasks
    When getCategoriesWithTaskCount is called
    Then each category should include the count of active tasks

tasks.title: Calendar Facade Implementation
tasks.description: Implement CalendarFacade to provide calendar-view specific operations and data formatting
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Calendar Facade
  Scenario: Get tasks for calendar month view
    Given a specific month and year
    When getTasksForMonth is called
    Then tasks should be grouped by date
    And the result should be optimized for calendar grid display

  Scenario: Get tasks for calendar week view
    Given a specific week
    When getTasksForWeek is called
    Then tasks should be grouped by date and time slots
    And all-day tasks should be separated from timed tasks

tasks.title: Main Application Window UI
tasks.description: Design and implement the main application window with a modern, clean interface including sidebar navigation, main content area, and quick action bar
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Main Application Window
  Scenario: Main window layout
    Given the application is launched
    When the main window is displayed
    Then it should have a collapsible sidebar on the left
    And a main content area in the center
    And a quick add bar at the top
    And the window should be resizable with minimum dimensions

  Scenario: Sidebar navigation
    Given the main window is displayed
    When viewing the sidebar
    Then it should show 'Today', 'Upcoming', 'Calendar', and 'All Tasks' sections
    And it should show the list of categories below
    And each category should display task count badge

tasks.title: Task List View Controller
tasks.description: Implement the controller for displaying and managing the task list view with sorting, filtering, and grouping options
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Task List View
  Scenario: Display task list
    Given tasks exist in the system
    When viewing the task list
    Then tasks should be displayed with title, due date, priority indicator, and category
    And completed tasks should be visually distinguished
    And overdue tasks should be highlighted

  Scenario: Filter tasks
    Given the task list is displayed
    When a filter is applied (by category, priority, or status)
    Then only matching tasks should be displayed
    And the filter state should be visually indicated

  Scenario: Sort tasks
    Given the task list is displayed
    When a sort option is selected (by date, priority, or name)
    Then tasks should be reordered according to the selected criteria

tasks.title: Task Detail Panel Controller
tasks.description: Implement the controller for the task detail/edit panel that slides in from the right when a task is selected
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Task Detail Panel
  Scenario: View task details
    Given a task is selected from the list
    When the detail panel opens
    Then all task fields should be displayed
    And the panel should slide in with smooth animation

  Scenario: Edit task inline
    Given the task detail panel is open
    When editing any field
    Then changes should be saved automatically after a brief delay
    And a visual indicator should show unsaved changes
    And a TaskUpdatedEvent should be published on save

  Scenario: Close panel
    Given the task detail panel is open
    When clicking outside or pressing Escape
    Then the panel should slide out
    And any unsaved changes should be saved

tasks.title: Quick Add Task Controller
tasks.description: Implement the quick add task bar that allows rapid task creation with natural language parsing
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Quick Add Task
  Scenario: Quick add with natural language
    Given the quick add bar is focused
    When typing 'Call John tomorrow at 3pm #work !high'
    Then the input should be parsed in real-time
    And parsed elements should be highlighted (date, time, category, priority)

  Scenario: Submit quick add task
    Given a task has been typed in the quick add bar
    When pressing Enter
    Then the task should be created with parsed attributes
    And the input should be cleared
    And the new task should appear in the list

  Scenario: Quick add suggestions
    Given the user is typing in the quick add bar
    When typing '#' or '@'
    Then autocomplete suggestions should appear for categories or contacts

tasks.title: Calendar View Controller
tasks.description: Implement the calendar view with month, week, and day views showing scheduled tasks
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Calendar View
  Scenario: Month view display
    Given the calendar view is in month mode
    When viewing the calendar
    Then a monthly grid should be displayed
    And days with tasks should show task indicators
    And clicking a day should show tasks for that day

  Scenario: Week view display
    Given the calendar view is in week mode
    When viewing the calendar
    Then a weekly time grid should be displayed
    And tasks should be positioned according to their scheduled time
    And tasks can be dragged to reschedule

  Scenario: Drag and drop scheduling
    Given a task in the calendar view
    When dragging the task to a different time slot
    Then the task schedule should be updated
    And a TaskScheduledEvent should be published

tasks.title: Category Management Dialog Controller
tasks.description: Implement the dialog for managing categories: create, edit, delete, and reorder
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Category Management Dialog
  Scenario: Create new category
    Given the category management dialog is open
    When filling in category name, color, and icon
    And clicking Save
    Then the category should be created
    And the dialog should close
    And the sidebar should update with the new category

  Scenario: Edit category
    Given an existing category
    When editing its properties
    Then changes should be saved
    And all tasks in that category should reflect visual changes

  Scenario: Reorder categories
    Given multiple categories
    When dragging a category to a new position
    Then the sort order should be updated
    And the sidebar should reflect the new order

tasks.title: System Tray Integration
tasks.description: Implement system tray icon with context menu for quick actions and application visibility control
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: System Tray Integration
  Scenario: Application minimizes to tray
    Given the application is running
    When minimizing the window
    Then the application should minimize to system tray
    And a tray icon should be visible

  Scenario: Tray context menu
    Given the application is in system tray
    When right-clicking the tray icon
    Then a context menu should appear with 'Show', 'Quick Add', 'Today's Tasks', and 'Exit' options

  Scenario: Restore from tray
    Given the application is minimized to tray
    When clicking the tray icon
    Then the main window should be restored and focused

tasks.title: Global Keyboard Shortcut - Windows
tasks.description: Implement global keyboard shortcut (e.g., Ctrl+Shift+A) that works system-wide on Windows to show the quick add dialog
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Global Shortcut Windows
  Scenario: Register global shortcut on Windows
    Given the application is running on Windows
    When the application starts
    Then a global keyboard shortcut should be registered using JNativeHook or JNA
    And the shortcut should work even when the application is not focused

  Scenario: Trigger quick add from global shortcut
    Given the application is running in background on Windows
    When pressing the global shortcut (Ctrl+Shift+A)
    Then a floating quick add dialog should appear
    And the dialog should be focused and ready for input

  Scenario: Dismiss quick add dialog
    Given the quick add dialog is open via global shortcut
    When pressing Escape or clicking outside
    Then the dialog should close
    And focus should return to the previous application

tasks.title: Global Keyboard Shortcut - Linux
tasks.description: Implement global keyboard shortcut that works system-wide on Linux to show the quick add dialog
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Global Shortcut Linux
  Scenario: Register global shortcut on Linux
    Given the application is running on Linux
    When the application starts
    Then a global keyboard shortcut should be registered using JNativeHook or X11 bindings
    And the shortcut should work across different desktop environments (GNOME, KDE, XFCE)

  Scenario: Trigger quick add from global shortcut on Linux
    Given the application is running in background on Linux
    When pressing the global shortcut (Ctrl+Shift+A)
    Then a floating quick add dialog should appear centered on screen

tasks.title: Startup on System Boot - Windows
tasks.description: Implement functionality to optionally start the application when Windows boots up
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Startup on Boot Windows
  Scenario: Enable startup on Windows
    Given the application settings
    When 'Start on system boot' is enabled
    Then a registry entry or startup folder shortcut should be created
    And the application should start minimized on next boot

  Scenario: Disable startup on Windows
    Given startup is enabled
    When 'Start on system boot' is disabled
    Then the registry entry or shortcut should be removed

tasks.title: Startup on System Boot - Linux
tasks.description: Implement functionality to optionally start the application when Linux boots up
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Startup on Boot Linux
  Scenario: Enable startup on Linux
    Given the application settings
    When 'Start on system boot' is enabled
    Then a .desktop file should be created in ~/.config/autostart/
    And the application should start minimized on next boot

  Scenario: Disable startup on Linux
    Given startup is enabled
    When 'Start on system boot' is disabled
    Then the autostart .desktop file should be removed

tasks.title: Settings/Preferences Dialog
tasks.description: Implement a settings dialog for user preferences including appearance, shortcuts, notifications, and startup behavior
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Settings Dialog
  Scenario: Open settings dialog
    Given the application is running
    When opening settings (via menu or shortcut)
    Then a settings dialog should appear with categorized options

  Scenario: General settings
    Given the settings dialog is open
    When viewing general settings
    Then options for startup behavior, default view, and language should be available

  Scenario: Appearance settings
    Given the settings dialog is open
    When viewing appearance settings
    Then options for theme (light/dark), accent color, and font size should be available

  Scenario: Save settings
    Given settings have been modified
    When clicking Save or closing the dialog
    Then settings should be persisted
    And applicable changes should take effect immediately

tasks.title: Light and Dark Theme Support
tasks.description: Implement light and dark theme support with the ability to switch themes and optionally follow system preferences
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Theme Support
  Scenario: Switch to dark theme
    Given the application is using light theme
    When switching to dark theme in settings
    Then all UI components should update to dark colors
    And the change should be immediate without restart

  Scenario: Follow system theme
    Given 'Follow system theme' is enabled
    When the system theme changes
    Then the application theme should automatically update

  Scenario: Theme persistence
    Given a theme has been selected
    When restarting the application
    Then the selected theme should be applied on startup

tasks.title: Task Priority Visual Indicators
tasks.description: Implement visual indicators for task priority levels using colors, icons, or badges that are consistent throughout the application
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Priority Visual Indicators
  Scenario: Priority colors in task list
    Given tasks with different priorities
    When viewing the task list
    Then URGENT tasks should have red indicator
    And HIGH priority tasks should have orange indicator
    And MEDIUM priority tasks should have yellow indicator
    And LOW priority tasks should have gray or no indicator

  Scenario: Priority in calendar view
    Given tasks in calendar view
    When viewing scheduled tasks
    Then task blocks should be color-coded by priority

tasks.title: Drag and Drop Task Reordering
tasks.description: Implement drag and drop functionality to reorder tasks in the list and move tasks between categories
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Drag and Drop Tasks
  Scenario: Reorder tasks in list
    Given a task list with multiple tasks
    When dragging a task to a new position
    Then the task should move to the new position
    And a visual indicator should show the drop target
    And other tasks should shift to accommodate

  Scenario: Move task to different category
    Given a task in one category
    When dragging the task to a different category in the sidebar
    Then the task should be moved to the new category
    And a TaskMovedToCategoryEvent should be published

tasks.title: Task Search Functionality
tasks.description: Implement full-text search across task titles, descriptions, and tags
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Task Search
  Scenario: Search tasks by keyword
    Given tasks with various titles and descriptions
    When entering a search query
    Then matching tasks should be displayed
    And matching text should be highlighted
    And search should include title, description, and tags

  Scenario: Search filters
    Given search results are displayed
    When applying additional filters
    Then results should be narrowed by selected filters

  Scenario: Clear search
    Given an active search
    When clearing the search box
    Then the view should return to the previous state

tasks.title: Keyboard Navigation and Shortcuts
tasks.description: Implement comprehensive keyboard navigation and shortcuts throughout the application
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Keyboard Navigation
  Scenario: Navigate task list with keyboard
    Given the task list is focused
    When pressing Up/Down arrows
    Then focus should move between tasks
    And pressing Enter should open task details
    And pressing Delete should delete the task with confirmation

  Scenario: Application shortcuts
    Given the application is focused
    When pressing Ctrl+N
    Then a new task dialog should open
    When pressing Ctrl+F
    Then the search bar should be focused
    When pressing Ctrl+1/2/3/4
    Then the view should switch to Today/Upcoming/Calendar/All Tasks

tasks.title: Task Due Date Notifications
tasks.description: Implement system notifications for task due dates and reminders
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Due Date Notifications
  Scenario: Notification before due date
    Given a task with a reminder set for 30 minutes before
    When 30 minutes before the due time
    Then a system notification should appear
    And the notification should show task title and due time
    And clicking the notification should open the task

  Scenario: Overdue notification
    Given a task that has become overdue
    When the task due time passes
    Then a notification should inform the user of the overdue task

  Scenario: Notification snooze
    Given a reminder notification is shown
    When clicking snooze
    Then the notification should be dismissed
    And a new reminder should be scheduled for the snooze duration

tasks.title: Recurring Tasks
tasks.description: Implement recurring task functionality with various recurrence patterns (daily, weekly, monthly, custom)
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Recurring Tasks
  Scenario: Create daily recurring task
    Given task creation form
    When setting recurrence to 'Daily'
    Then the task should appear each day until end date or indefinitely

  Scenario: Create weekly recurring task
    Given task creation form
    When setting recurrence to 'Weekly' on specific days
    Then the task should appear on selected days of each week

  Scenario: Complete recurring task instance
    Given a recurring task instance
    When marking it complete
    Then only that instance should be marked complete
    And the next instance should be generated

  Scenario: Edit recurring task series
    Given a recurring task
    When editing and choosing 'Edit all instances'
    Then all future instances should be updated

tasks.title: Task Time Tracking
tasks.description: Implement time tracking for tasks with start/stop timer and manual time entry
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Time Tracking
  Scenario: Start task timer
    Given a task without active timer
    When clicking the play button
    Then a timer should start for that task
    And the elapsed time should be displayed and updating

  Scenario: Stop task timer
    Given a task with active timer
    When clicking the stop button
    Then the timer should stop
    And the elapsed time should be added to actual duration
    And a TimeTrackedEvent should be published

  Scenario: View time report
    Given tasks with tracked time
    When viewing time report for a date range
    Then total time per category and per task should be displayed

tasks.title: Undo/Redo Functionality
tasks.description: Implement undo/redo functionality for task and category operations
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Undo Redo
  Scenario: Undo task deletion
    Given a task was just deleted
    When pressing Ctrl+Z or clicking Undo
    Then the task should be restored
    And a toast notification should confirm the undo

  Scenario: Redo undone action
    Given an action was undone
    When pressing Ctrl+Y or clicking Redo
    Then the action should be reapplied

  Scenario: Undo toast notification
    Given an action was performed (like delete)
    When the action completes
    Then a toast should appear with Undo option
    And the toast should auto-dismiss after 5 seconds

tasks.title: Today View with Smart Grouping
tasks.description: Implement a Today view that shows overdue tasks, today's scheduled tasks, and suggested tasks with smart grouping
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Today View
  Scenario: Today view sections
    Given tasks with various due dates
    When viewing the Today view
    Then 'Overdue' section should show past due tasks
    And 'Today' section should show tasks due today
    And sections should be collapsible

  Scenario: Morning and afternoon grouping
    Given tasks scheduled for different times today
    When viewing Today view
    Then tasks should be grouped into time blocks (Morning, Afternoon, Evening)

  Scenario: Today view empty state
    Given no tasks for today
    When viewing Today view
    Then a friendly empty state message should be displayed
    And a quick add button should be prominently displayed

tasks.title: Upcoming View with Timeline
tasks.description: Implement an Upcoming view that shows tasks for the next 7 days and beyond grouped by date
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Upcoming View
  Scenario: Upcoming view date grouping
    Given tasks scheduled for future dates
    When viewing Upcoming view
    Then tasks should be grouped by date
    And dates should show relative labels (Tomorrow, This Week, Next Week)

  Scenario: Upcoming view navigation
    Given the Upcoming view is displayed
    When scrolling or using navigation controls
    Then additional future dates should load
    And performance should remain smooth with many tasks

tasks.title: Task Tags/Labels System
tasks.description: Implement a tagging system for tasks allowing multiple tags per task with autocomplete and filtering
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Task Tags
  Scenario: Add tags to task
    Given a task being created or edited
    When adding tags
    Then multiple tags should be supported
    And tags should autocomplete from existing tags
    And new tags should be created if not existing

  Scenario: Filter by tags
    Given tasks with various tags
    When selecting a tag filter
    Then only tasks with that tag should be displayed
    And multiple tag filters should work with AND logic

  Scenario: Tag management
    Given existing tags
    When managing tags
    Then tags can be renamed or deleted
    And deleting a tag should remove it from all tasks

tasks.title: Subtasks/Checklist Support
tasks.description: Implement subtasks or checklist items within tasks
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Subtasks
  Scenario: Add subtasks to a task
    Given a task being edited
    When adding subtasks
    Then multiple subtasks should be supported
    And subtasks should have checkboxes for completion

  Scenario: Subtask completion affects progress
    Given a task with subtasks
    When completing subtasks
    Then a progress indicator should show completion percentage
    And completing all subtasks should prompt to complete parent task

  Scenario: Reorder subtasks
    Given a task with multiple subtasks
    When dragging subtasks
    Then the order should update

tasks.title: Smooth Animations and Transitions
tasks.description: Implement smooth animations and transitions for UI interactions to enhance user experience
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: UI Animations
  Scenario: List item animations
    Given tasks in a list
    When a task is added
    Then it should animate into position
    When a task is removed
    Then it should animate out smoothly

  Scenario: Panel transitions
    Given the detail panel is closed
    When opening the detail panel
    Then it should slide in from the right with smooth animation
    And content should fade in

  Scenario: Checkbox animations
    Given a task with unchecked checkbox
    When checking the checkbox
    Then a satisfying checkmark animation should play
    And the task should have a completion animation

tasks.title: Responsive Layout Design
tasks.description: Implement responsive layout that adapts to different window sizes and supports minimized/compact views
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Responsive Layout
  Scenario: Narrow window layout
    Given the window width is reduced below threshold
    When the window is narrow
    Then the sidebar should collapse to icons only
    And the detail panel should become a modal overlay

  Scenario: Wide window layout
    Given a wide window
    When viewing tasks
    Then sidebar, list, and detail panel should be visible simultaneously

  Scenario: Compact mode
    Given compact mode is enabled in settings
    When viewing the application
    Then UI density should increase with smaller spacing and fonts

tasks.title: Empty States and Onboarding
tasks.description: Implement friendly empty states for lists and first-time user onboarding
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Empty States and Onboarding
  Scenario: First time user onboarding
    Given a new user opens the application for the first time
    When the main window appears
    Then an onboarding overlay or wizard should guide them through key features
    And sample tasks and categories should optionally be created

  Scenario: Empty category state
    Given a category with no tasks
    When viewing that category
    Then a helpful empty state with illustration should be shown
    And a clear call-to-action to add a task should be visible

  Scenario: Skip onboarding
    Given the onboarding is shown
    When clicking 'Skip'
    Then onboarding should close and not show again

tasks.title: Natural Language Date Parsing
tasks.description: Implement natural language parsing for dates and times in task input (e.g., 'tomorrow', 'next Monday', '3pm')
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Natural Language Date Parsing
  Scenario: Parse relative dates
    Given quick add input 'Buy milk tomorrow'
    When parsing the input
    Then 'tomorrow' should be parsed as the next day's date
    And the task should be created with that due date

  Scenario: Parse specific times
    Given quick add input 'Meeting at 3pm'
    When parsing the input
    Then '3pm' should be parsed as 15:00
    And the task should have that due time

  Scenario: Parse complex date expressions
    Given quick add input 'Report due next Friday'
    When parsing the input
    Then 'next Friday' should be parsed correctly
    And edge cases like weekends should be handled properly

tasks.title: Data Export and Import
tasks.description: Implement data export and import functionality for backup and migration purposes
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Data Export Import
  Scenario: Export all data
    Given the application has tasks and categories
    When exporting data
    Then a JSON file should be generated with all tasks, categories, and settings
    And the file should be downloadable to a chosen location

  Scenario: Import data
    Given a previously exported data file
    When importing data
    Then the user should choose merge or replace strategy
    And data should be imported according to the chosen strategy

  Scenario: Export to CSV
    Given tasks in the system
    When exporting to CSV
    Then a CSV file with task data should be generated
    And it should be compatible with spreadsheet applications

tasks.title: Application Logging and Error Handling
tasks.description: Implement comprehensive logging and error handling throughout the application
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Logging and Error Handling
  Scenario: Log application events
    Given the application is running
    When any significant action occurs
    Then it should be logged with timestamp and context
    And log levels should be configurable

  Scenario: Handle errors gracefully
    Given an error occurs (e.g., database failure)
    When the error is caught
    Then a user-friendly error message should be shown
    And the error should be logged with stack trace
    And the application should remain stable

  Scenario: View logs
    Given logged events exist
    When accessing the log viewer (or log file)
    Then recent logs should be viewable for troubleshooting

tasks.title: Unit Tests - Repository Layer
tasks.description: Write comprehensive unit tests for all repository classes using JUnit and Mockito
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Repository Unit Tests
  Scenario: Test TaskRepository CRUD operations
    Given a TaskRepository with mocked MapDB
    When testing save, findById, findAll, update, and delete
    Then all operations should behave correctly
    And edge cases should be handled

  Scenario: Test CategoryRepository operations
    Given a CategoryRepository with mocked MapDB
    When testing all category operations
    Then correct data should be returned
    And errors should be handled appropriately

  Scenario: Test query methods
    Given repositories with test data
    When testing complex queries (findByDueDateBetween, findByCategoryId)
    Then correct filtered results should be returned

tasks.title: Unit Tests - Service Layer
tasks.description: Write comprehensive unit tests for all service classes
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Service Unit Tests
  Scenario: Test TaskService with mocked dependencies
    Given a TaskService with mocked repository and event to state flow
    When testing createTask, updateTask, completeTask, deleteTask
    Then repository should be called correctly
    And appropriate events should be published

  Scenario: Test business logic
    Given a TaskService
    When testing recurring task completion
    Then next occurrence should be created correctly

  Scenario: Test CategoryService
    Given a CategoryService with mocked dependencies
    When testing all category operations
    Then business rules should be enforced
    And events should be published correctly

tasks.title: Unit Tests - Facade Layer
tasks.description: Write comprehensive unit tests for all facade classes
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Facade Unit Tests
  Scenario: Test TaskFacade operations
    Given a TaskFacade with mocked services
    When testing getTasksForToday, quickAddTask, getTaskStatistics
    Then services should be coordinated correctly
    And correct DTOs should be returned

  Scenario: Test quick add parsing
    Given a TaskFacade
    When testing quickAddTask with various natural language inputs
    Then dates, times, priorities, and tags should be parsed correctly

  Scenario: Test CalendarFacade
    Given a CalendarFacade with mocked services
    When testing getTasksForMonth, getTasksForWeek
    Then data should be formatted correctly for calendar display

tasks.title: Unit Tests - Mapper Layer
tasks.description: Write unit tests for MapStruct mappers to ensure correct field mapping
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Mapper Unit Tests
  Scenario: Test TaskMapper conversions
    Given a Task entity with all fields populated
    When mapping to TaskDTO and back
    Then all fields should be correctly mapped
    And null handling should be correct

  Scenario: Test CategoryMapper conversions
    Given a Category entity
    When mapping to CategoryDTO and back
    Then all fields should be correctly mapped

  Scenario: Test collection mapping
    Given a list of entities
    When mapping to list of DTOs
    Then all items should be correctly mapped

tasks.title: Unit Tests - UI Controllers
tasks.description: Write unit tests for UI controllers using TestFX or similar JavaFX testing framework
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Controller Unit Tests
  Scenario: Test TaskListViewController
    Given a TaskListViewController with mocked facade
    When testing task list loading and filtering
    Then correct data should be displayed

  Scenario: Test QuickAddController parsing
    Given a QuickAddController
    When testing input parsing and task creation
    Then facade should be called with correct parameters

  Scenario: Test UI event handling
    Given a controller
    When simulating user interactions
    Then correct actions should be triggered

tasks.title: Unit Tests - Event System
tasks.description: Write unit tests for the event setup and all event classes
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Event System Unit Tests
  Scenario: Test Event setup subscription and publishing
    Given an Event setup instance
    When subscribing and publishing events
    Then subscribers should receive events correctly
    And unsubscribed handlers should not receive events

  Scenario: Test event serialization
    Given event classes
    When serializing and deserializing events
    Then all event data should be preserved

  Scenario: Test event ordering
    Given multiple events published
    When processing events
    Then they should be processed in order

tasks.title: Integration Tests - Database
tasks.description: Write integration tests for MapDB database operations with actual database files
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Database Integration Tests
  Scenario: Test database persistence
    Given tasks saved to MapDB
    When closing and reopening the database
    Then all tasks should be retrievable

  Scenario: Test transaction behavior
    Given a transaction with multiple operations
    When an error occurs mid-transaction
    Then the transaction should be rolled back

  Scenario: Test concurrent access
    Given multiple threads accessing the database
    When performing concurrent operations
    Then data integrity should be maintained

tasks.title: Focus Mode / Do Not Disturb
tasks.description: Implement a focus mode that hides notifications and non-essential UI elements
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Focus Mode
  Scenario: Enable focus mode
    Given the application is running normally
    When enabling focus mode
    Then notifications should be suppressed
    And UI should simplify to show only current tasks
    And a focus timer should optionally start

  Scenario: Focus mode timer
    Given focus mode is enabled with a timer
    When the timer expires
    Then focus mode should automatically disable
    And suppressed notifications should be shown

  Scenario: Focus mode break reminders
    Given extended focus mode session
    When a break interval is reached
    Then a gentle break reminder should appear

tasks.title: Task Duration Estimation
tasks.description: Allow users to set estimated duration for tasks and display them appropriately in calendar views
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Task Duration Estimation
  Scenario: Set task duration
    Given a task being created or edited
    When setting estimated duration
    Then duration should be stored with the task
    And duration picker should allow common increments (15m, 30m, 1h, etc.)

  Scenario: Display duration in calendar
    Given a task with duration in calendar view
    When viewing the calendar
    Then the task block should span the estimated duration
    And overlapping tasks should be handled appropriately

  Scenario: Compare estimated vs actual
    Given a task with estimated and actual duration
    When viewing task details
    Then both durations should be displayed for comparison

tasks.title: Inbox for Quick Capture
tasks.description: Implement an Inbox section for quickly capturing tasks that haven't been scheduled or categorized yet
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Inbox
  Scenario: Quick capture to inbox
    Given the quick add bar
    When adding a task without date or category
    Then the task should appear in the Inbox

  Scenario: Process inbox
    Given tasks in the Inbox
    When viewing the Inbox
    Then each task should have quick actions to schedule, categorize, or delete
    And empty inbox should show congratulatory message

  Scenario: Inbox count badge
    Given unprocessed tasks in Inbox
    When viewing the sidebar
    Then the Inbox should show a count badge

tasks.title: Application Update Check
tasks.description: Implement automatic update checking with user notification when new versions are available
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Update Check
  Scenario: Check for updates on startup
    Given the application starts
    When checking for updates (if enabled)
    Then a version check should be performed against update server
    And if new version available, user should be notified

  Scenario: Manual update check
    Given the settings or help menu
    When clicking 'Check for Updates'
    Then current and latest version should be compared
    And download link should be provided if update available

  Scenario: Update notification
    Given an update is available
    When notification is shown
    Then user can choose to download, skip, or remind later

tasks.title: Accessibility Support
tasks.description: Implement accessibility features including screen reader support, keyboard navigation, and high contrast mode
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Accessibility
  Scenario: Screen reader support
    Given a user using a screen reader
    When navigating the application
    Then all interactive elements should have proper labels
    And focus changes should be announced

  Scenario: High contrast mode
    Given a user enables high contrast mode
    When viewing the application
    Then colors should meet WCAG contrast requirements
    And important elements should be clearly distinguishable

  Scenario: Full keyboard navigation
    Given a user navigating with keyboard only
    When using the application
    Then all features should be accessible via keyboard
    And focus indicators should be clearly visible

tasks.title: Localization Infrastructure
tasks.description: Set up localization infrastructure for internationalization with support for multiple languages
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Localization
  Scenario: Load language resources
    Given resource bundles for different languages
    When the application starts
    Then the appropriate language bundle should be loaded based on user preference or system locale

  Scenario: Change language at runtime
    Given the settings dialog
    When changing the language
    Then all UI text should update to the selected language
    And the preference should be saved

  Scenario: Handle missing translations
    Given a translation key without translation in current language
    When rendering text
    Then fallback to default language should occur gracefully

tasks.title: Performance Optimization
tasks.description: Optimize application performance for smooth operation with large numbers of tasks
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Performance Optimization
  Scenario: Handle large task collections
    Given 10,000+ tasks in the database
    When loading and displaying tasks
    Then UI should remain responsive
    And list virtualization should be used

  Scenario: Fast search performance
    Given a large task database
    When searching for tasks
    Then results should appear within 200ms
    And search should use efficient indexing

  Scenario: Memory management
    Given extended application usage
    When monitoring memory
    Then memory usage should remain stable
    And no memory leaks should occur

tasks.title: Database Migration System
tasks.description: Implement a database migration system to handle schema changes between application versions
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Database Migration
  Scenario: Detect schema version mismatch
    Given an older database version
    When the application starts
    Then the schema version should be detected
    And migration should be triggered automatically

  Scenario: Execute migration scripts
    Given pending migrations
    When migrations run
    Then data should be transformed to new schema
    And migration should be atomic (all or nothing)

  Scenario: Backup before migration
    Given a migration is about to run
    When migration starts
    Then a backup of the database should be created
    And user should be notified of the backup location

tasks.title: Context Menu Actions
tasks.description: Implement context menus (right-click menus) for tasks and categories with relevant actions
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Context Menus
  Scenario: Task context menu
    Given a task in the list
    When right-clicking the task
    Then a context menu should appear with options: Edit, Complete, Schedule, Move to Category, Duplicate, Delete

  Scenario: Category context menu
    Given a category in the sidebar
    When right-clicking the category
    Then a context menu should appear with options: Edit, Add Task, Delete

  Scenario: Multiple selection context menu
    Given multiple selected tasks
    When right-clicking
    Then bulk actions should be available (Complete All, Move All, Delete All)

tasks.title: Task Snooze Functionality
tasks.description: Implement the ability to snooze tasks to a later time or date
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Task Snooze
  Scenario: Snooze task from list
    Given a task in the Today view
    When clicking snooze button
    Then quick snooze options should appear (Later Today, Tomorrow, Next Week)
    And custom date/time option should be available

  Scenario: Snoozed task behavior
    Given a task is snoozed to tomorrow
    When viewing Today
    Then the task should not appear in Today
    And the task should appear tomorrow

  Scenario: Snooze from notification
    Given a task reminder notification
    When clicking snooze on notification
    Then snooze options should be available

tasks.title: Weekly Review Feature
tasks.description: Implement a weekly review feature that helps users review completed tasks and plan for the upcoming week
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Weekly Review
  Scenario: Start weekly review
    Given it's time for weekly review (or manual trigger)
    When starting the review
    Then a guided review wizard should open

  Scenario: Review completed tasks
    Given the weekly review wizard
    When on the review step
    Then completed tasks from past week should be shown
    And statistics about completion rate should be displayed

  Scenario: Plan next week
    Given the weekly review wizard
    When on the planning step
    Then upcoming tasks should be reviewable
    And tasks can be rescheduled or prioritized

tasks.title: Task Notes and Attachments
tasks.description: Allow adding rich notes and file attachments to tasks
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Notes and Attachments
  Scenario: Add notes to task
    Given a task being edited
    When adding notes
    Then rich text formatting should be supported (bold, italic, lists)
    And notes should be saved with the task

  Scenario: Add file attachment
    Given a task being edited
    When attaching a file
    Then the file should be stored with the task
    And the attachment should be openable from the task detail

  Scenario: Attachment size limits
    Given file attachment
    When attaching a very large file
    Then a warning should be shown about file size
    And reasonable size limits should be enforced

tasks.title: Quick Actions Menu
tasks.description: Implement a command palette style quick actions menu accessible via keyboard shortcut
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Quick Actions Menu
  Scenario: Open quick actions
    Given the application is focused
    When pressing Ctrl+Shift+P
    Then a quick actions menu should appear
    And recently used actions should be shown first

  Scenario: Search actions
    Given the quick actions menu is open
    When typing a search query
    Then matching actions should be filtered and shown
    And actions can be selected with keyboard

  Scenario: Execute action
    Given an action is selected in quick actions menu
    When pressing Enter
    Then the action should be executed
    And the menu should close

tasks.title: Statistics and Productivity Dashboard
tasks.description: Implement a dashboard showing productivity statistics and task completion trends
tasks.acceptanceCriteria:
Feature: Statistics Dashboard
  Scenario: View productivity dashboard
    Given the statistics view
    When viewing the dashboard
    Then task completion trends should be shown (daily, weekly, monthly)
    And charts should visualize the data

  Scenario: Category breakdown
    Given tasks across categories
    When viewing statistics
    Then time spent per category should be shown
    And task distribution should be visualized

  Scenario: Streak tracking
    Given daily task completions
    When viewing statistics
    Then current streak of productive days should be shown
    And longest streak should be displayed
